Temple Tours роХрпЛро╡ро┐ро▓рпН роЪрпБро▒рпНро▒рпБро▓ро╛

Mahabalipuram & ECR Temples роороХро╛рокро▓ро┐рокрпБро░роорпН & ECR Temples (Half-Day / Full-Day)

Explore the UNESCO World Heritage sites of Mahabalipuram including the Shore Temple, Five Rathas, and Arjuna's Penance. Enjoy a scenic drive along the East Coast Road (ECR) with options to visit other temples en route. Explore the UNESCO World Heritage sites of роороХро╛рокро▓ро┐рокрпБро░роорпН including the Shore Temple, Five Rathas, and Arjuna's Penance. Enjoy a scenic drive along the East Coast Road (ECR) with options to visit other temples en route.

Route Plan рокропрогродрпН родро┐роЯрпНроЯроорпН

1

Chennai Start

Pickup at 8:00 AM.

2

ECR Stops

Iskcon, DakshinaChitra, or Crocodile Bank (Optional).

3

Mahabalipuram

Shore Temple, Five Rathas, Arjuna's Penance.

4

Sea Shell Museum

Visit India's largest seashell museum.

5

Chennai Drop

Return by 7:00 PM.

Travel Guide & Tips рокропрог ро╡ро┤ро┐роХро╛роЯрпНроЯро┐ & роХрпБро▒ро┐рокрпНрокрпБроХро│рпН

History & Significance ро╡ро░ро▓ро╛ро▒рпБ & роЪро┐ро▒рокрпНрокрпБ

Mahabalipuram (Mamallapuram) was a bustling seaport of the Pallava kings in the 7th century. It is known for its rock-cut temples and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Mahabalipuram (Mamallapuram) was a bustling seaport of the Pallava kings in the 7th century. It is known for its rock-cut temples and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Darshan Timings родро░ро┐роЪрой роирпЗро░роЩрпНроХро│рпН

Monuments: 6:00 AM тАУ 6:00 PM Light House: 10:00 AM тАУ 5:00 PM Monuments: 6:00 AM тАУ 6:00 PM Light House: 10:00 AM тАУ 5:00 PM

Dress Code роЖроЯрпИ роХроЯрпНроЯрпБрокрпНрокро╛роЯрпБ

Comfortable cotton clothes, hat/cap, and walking shoes recommended. Comfortable cotton clothes, hat/cap, and walking shoes recommended.

Pro Tips for First-Timers роорпБроХрпНроХро┐роп роХрпБро▒ро┐рокрпНрокрпБроХро│рпН

  • Carry an umbrella and water (it gets hot).
  • Visit Krishna's Butter Ball for unique photos.
  • Sea Shell Museum is great for kids.
  • Don't miss the Shore Temple at sunset.
